environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_ALLOW_REQUEST_OVERRIDES
environmentVariables.description: When set to true, allows configuration values to be overridden via request headers and query parameters.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_API_CLIENT_ID
environmentVariables.description: Atlas API client ID for authentication. Required for running Atlas tools.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_API_CLIENT_SECRET
environmentVariables.description: Atlas API client secret for authentication. Required for running Atlas tools.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_ATLAS_TEMPORARY_DATABASE_USER_LIFETIME_MS
environmentVariables.description: Time in milliseconds that temporary database users created when connecting to MongoDB Atlas clusters will remain active before being automatically deleted.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_CONFIRMATION_REQUIRED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma separated values of tool names that require user confirmation before execution. Requires the client to support elicitation.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_CONNECTION_STRING
environmentVariables.description: MongoDB connection string for direct database connections. Optional, if not set, you'll need to call the connect tool before interacting with MongoDB data.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_DISABLED_TOOLS
environmentVariables.description: Comma separated values of tool names, operation types, and/or categories of tools that will be disabled.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_DRY_RUN
environmentVariables.description: When true, runs the server in dry mode: dumps configuration and enabled tools, then exits without starting the server.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_EMBEDDINGS_VALIDATION
environmentVariables.description: When set to false, disables validation of embeddings dimensions.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_EXPORT_CLEANUP_INTERVAL_MS
environmentVariables.description: Time in milliseconds between export cleanup cycles that remove expired export files.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_EXPORT_TIMEOUT_MS
environmentVariables.description: Time in milliseconds after which an export is considered expired and eligible for cleanup.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_EXPORTS_PATH
environmentVariables.description: Folder to store exported data files.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_EXTERNALLY_MANAGED_SESSIONS
environmentVariables.description: When true, the HTTP transport allows requests with a session ID supplied externally through the 'mcp-session-id' header. When an external ID is supplied, the initialization request is optional.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_HTTP_BODY_LIMIT
environmentVariables.description: Maximum size of the HTTP request body in bytes (only used when transport is 'http'). This value is passed as the optional limit parameter to the Express.js json() middleware.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_HTTP_HEADERS
environmentVariables.description: Header that the HTTP server will validate when making requests (only used when transport is 'http').

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_HTTP_HOST
environmentVariables.description: Host address to bind the HTTP server to (only used when transport is 'http').

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_HTTP_PORT
environmentVariables.description: Port number for the HTTP server (only used when transport is 'http'). Use 0 for a random port.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_HTTP_RESPONSE_TYPE
environmentVariables.description: The HTTP response type for tool responses: 'sse' for Server-Sent Events, 'json' for standard JSON responses.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_IDLE_TIMEOUT_MS
environmentVariables.description: Idle timeout for a client to disconnect (only applies to http transport).

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_INDEX_CHECK
environmentVariables.description: When set to true, enforces that query operations must use an index, rejecting queries that perform a collection scan.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_LOG_PATH
environmentVariables.description: Folder to store logs.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_LOGGERS
environmentVariables.description: Comma separated values of logger types.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_MAX_BYTES_PER_QUERY
environmentVariables.description: The maximum size in bytes for results from a find or aggregate tool call. This serves as an upper bound for the responseBytesLimit parameter in those tools.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_MAX_DOCUMENTS_PER_QUERY
environmentVariables.description: The maximum number of documents that can be returned by a find or aggregate tool call. For the find tool, the effective limit will be the smaller of this value and the tool's limit parameter.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_NOTIFICATION_TIMEOUT_MS
environmentVariables.description: Notification timeout for a client to be aware of disconnect (only applies to http transport).

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_PREVIEW_FEATURES
environmentVariables.description: Comma separated values of preview features that are enabled.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_READ_ONLY
environmentVariables.description: When set to true, only allows read, connect, and metadata operation types, disabling create/update/delete operations.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_TELEMETRY
environmentVariables.description: When set to disabled, disables telemetry collection.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_TRANSPORT
environmentVariables.description: Either 'stdio' or 'http'.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_VECTOR_SEARCH_DIMENSIONS
environmentVariables.description: Default number of dimensions for vector search embeddings.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_VECTOR_SEARCH_SIMILARITY_FUNCTION
environmentVariables.description: Default similarity function for vector search: 'euclidean', 'cosine', or 'dotProduct'.

environmentVariables.name: MDB_MCP_VOYAGE_API_KEY
environmentVariables.description: API key for Voyage AI embeddings service (required for vector search operations with text-to-embedding conversion).

packageArguments.name: --allowRequestOverrides
packageArguments.description: When set to true, allows configuration values to be overridden via request headers and query parameters.

packageArguments.name: --apiClientId
packageArguments.description: Atlas API client ID for authentication. Required for running Atlas tools.

packageArguments.name: --apiClientSecret
packageArguments.description: Atlas API client secret for authentication. Required for running Atlas tools.

packageArguments.name: --atlasTemporaryDatabaseUserLifetimeMs
packageArguments.description: Time in milliseconds that temporary database users created when connecting to MongoDB Atlas clusters will remain active before being automatically deleted.

packageArguments.name: --confirmationRequiredTools
packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of tool names that require user confirmation before execution. Requires the client to support elicitation.

packageArguments.name: --connectionString
packageArguments.description: MongoDB connection string for direct database connections. Optional, if not set, you'll need to call the connect tool before interacting with MongoDB data.

packageArguments.name: --disabledTools
packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of tool names, operation types, and/or categories of tools that will be disabled.

packageArguments.name: --dryRun
packageArguments.description: When true, runs the server in dry mode: dumps configuration and enabled tools, then exits without starting the server.

packageArguments.name: --embeddingsValidation
packageArguments.description: When set to false, disables validation of embeddings dimensions.

packageArguments.name: --exportCleanupIntervalMs
packageArguments.description: Time in milliseconds between export cleanup cycles that remove expired export files.

packageArguments.name: --exportTimeoutMs
packageArguments.description: Time in milliseconds after which an export is considered expired and eligible for cleanup.

packageArguments.name: --exportsPath
packageArguments.description: Folder to store exported data files.

packageArguments.name: --externallyManagedSessions
packageArguments.description: When true, the HTTP transport allows requests with a session ID supplied externally through the 'mcp-session-id' header. When an external ID is supplied, the initialization request is optional.

packageArguments.name: --httpBodyLimit
packageArguments.description: Maximum size of the HTTP request body in bytes (only used when transport is 'http'). This value is passed as the optional limit parameter to the Express.js json() middleware.

packageArguments.name: --httpHeaders
packageArguments.description: Header that the HTTP server will validate when making requests (only used when transport is 'http').

packageArguments.name: --httpHost
packageArguments.description: Host address to bind the HTTP server to (only used when transport is 'http').

packageArguments.name: --httpPort
packageArguments.description: Port number for the HTTP server (only used when transport is 'http'). Use 0 for a random port.

packageArguments.name: --httpResponseType
packageArguments.description: The HTTP response type for tool responses: 'sse' for Server-Sent Events, 'json' for standard JSON responses.

packageArguments.name: --idleTimeoutMs
packageArguments.description: Idle timeout for a client to disconnect (only applies to http transport).

packageArguments.name: --indexCheck
packageArguments.description: When set to true, enforces that query operations must use an index, rejecting queries that perform a collection scan.

packageArguments.name: --logPath
packageArguments.description: Folder to store logs.

packageArguments.name: --loggers
packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of logger types.

packageArguments.name: --maxBytesPerQuery
packageArguments.description: The maximum size in bytes for results from a find or aggregate tool call. This serves as an upper bound for the responseBytesLimit parameter in those tools.

packageArguments.name: --maxDocumentsPerQuery
packageArguments.description: The maximum number of documents that can be returned by a find or aggregate tool call. For the find tool, the effective limit will be the smaller of this value and the tool's limit parameter.

packageArguments.name: --notificationTimeoutMs
packageArguments.description: Notification timeout for a client to be aware of disconnect (only applies to http transport).

packageArguments.name: --previewFeatures
packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of preview features that are enabled.

packageArguments.name: --readOnly
packageArguments.description: When set to true, only allows read, connect, and metadata operation types, disabling create/update/delete operations.

packageArguments.name: --telemetry
packageArguments.description: When set to disabled, disables telemetry collection.

packageArguments.name: --transport
packageArguments.description: Either 'stdio' or 'http'.

packageArguments.name: --vectorSearchDimensions
packageArguments.description: Default number of dimensions for vector search embeddings.

packageArguments.name: --vectorSearchSimilarityFunction
packageArguments.description: Default similarity function for vector search: 'euclidean', 'cosine', or 'dotProduct'.

packageArguments.name: --voyageApiKey
packageArguments.description: API key for Voyage AI embeddings service (required for vector search operations with text-to-embedding conversion).
